definition: acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: I need some water to quench .
Gives with it does myo- relieves thirst, is one kind of arrogant and willful simply.
sentences.chinese: 用它給乾性肌解渴，簡直是一種驕縱。

sentences.english: Or again, he is like a river or lake that quenches the thirst of many people .
sentences.chinese: 此外，他又像一條河或者一個湖，爲衆多的人解渴。

sentences.english: I want some water to quench.
Descend and appease your hunger with our bread and quench your thirst with our wine.
sentences.chinese: 下來用我們的麪包充飢，用我們的葡萄酒解渴吧。

sentences.english: Wine in the bottle does not quench thirst.
sentences.chinese: 瓶中之酒豈能解渴，畫餅豈能解飢。

sentences.english: Mung bean soup is not only cool to quench their thirst, have heat-clearing and detoxifying effect.
sentences.chinese: 綠豆湯不僅清涼解渴，還有清熱解毒的功效。

sentences.english: THIRST】The horse satisfied its thirst at the river.
sentences.chinese: 那匹馬在河邊痛飲解渴。

sentences.english: One can refresh oneself through drinking the delicious and strong tea.
sentences.chinese: 如此喝茶，香高味釅，提神解渴。

sentences.english: A cold beer would really wet my whistle.
A small amount of water reduces thirst.
White boiling water was the most thirst, the truth is the most beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 白開水才最解渴，大實話才最動人。

sentences.english: They give drink to every beast of the field; here wild asses quench their thirst .
sentences.chinese: 供給各種走獸水喝，使野驢也得以解渴。

sentences.english: If tea can satisfy one's thirst, well then tea house can make Sichuan more charming.
sentences.chinese: 茶解渴，茶館則使四川更加迷人。

sentences.english: Xiangbin served a bowl of bitter tea to thirsty me after we arrived home.
sentences.chinese: 到家了，相斌捧出一大碗苦茶讓我解渴。

sentences.english: He swigged the iced tea to relieve his thirst.
sentences.chinese: 他大口大口地喝冰茶以解渴。

definition: to spend a summer holiday/(esp of Chinese medicine) to relieve summer heat
to dissipate the effects of alcohol
to freshen up/to be cautious or vigilant/to watch out/stimulant to enhance mental performance/stay-awake drug/agrypnotic
